name: School Information Systems
overview: School Information Systems, Inc. provides K-12 educational-management software in the Midwest. Its products include Student Data Management, a K-12 Web-based solution for student data management that aggregates information from various school sites throughout a district to generate customized reports; and SISFin, a financial accounting and payroll system that comprises a selection of accounts-payable, general ledger, and revenue-tracking functions, as well as facilitates budget preparation and analysis. School Information Systems, Inc. also provides administratorâ€™s tools, such as comprehensive reporting, parent contact logs, instant email notifications, profile records, special services/IEP data tracking, and lunch account management; tools for technical directors; business mgr/CFO tools, such as online PO/invoice approval, automatic encumbering, budget preparation, salary schedules, leave tracking, purchasing card, and employee grouping options; teacherâ€™s tools, such as parent contact logs, classroom network, teacher grade book, and curriculum performance tracking; guidance counselorâ€™s tools, such as visual interactive random scheduling, student grades reporting, graduation credit summary, online four-year plans, career pathways, test score/assessment tracking, and class and subject databases; and various tools for parents and students. The company was founded in 1983 and is based in St. Louis, Missouri. As of August 2008, School Information Systems, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Tyler Technologies, Inc.
